title: 21-year-old British backpacker Amelia Bambridge missing after Cambodia beach party
text:
The family of a 21-year-old backpacker who went missing after a beach party in Cambodia have flown out to search for her.

Amelia Bambridge, from Worthing, West Sussex, was last seen by friends at around 3am on Wednesday at a beach party on the island of Koh Rong.

Ms Bambridge is on a gap year, and had been staying at the Nest Beach Club, 40 minutes from the beach where she was last seen.

Her mother, Linda Bambridge, was contacted by the manager of the hostel after she failed to check out and her purse, phone and bank cards were found on a nearby beach.

The backpacker has been officially reported missing, and her mother and other relatives have now flown to Cambodia to join locals in searching for her.

Linda Bambridge told The Argus newspaper it was “very out of character” for her daughter to go missing, adding that she was “normally so organised”.
description: The family of a 21-year-old backpacker who went missing after a beach party in Cambodia have flown out to search for her.
